poem:
### Crossfire

In the clamor of tongues,  
the laws unravel, a weave  
of intentions snagged.  
The mothers wait,  
a silent congregation,  
their futures measured  
in the scales of rhetoric.  
What hope in the language of men,  
when the gentle weight  
of lives flickers,  
lost in the crossfire?
